function_phrase: Let me back up for a second.
main_point: The professor explains Mineral polymorphs under pressure and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes subduction (a process) from lithosphere (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving magma chamber and tomography.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about an ethics aside to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for karst shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
